channel.title: Dot dot dot
channel.description: ok short... i got myself a nice stolen client but can't code at all.

item.title: Dot dot dot
item.dc:creator: @_N_eon (N)eon
item.description:
@_N_eon wrote:

I started learning java at a young age, but i got to a point that i stopped. I started coding RSPS, and im 70% self taught ( Besides when i first started )

One you go through topics that say " ERROR OMFG PLWEASE HELP!!! " and find out what the error was and how to fix, it will all add up and you can get started to create your own and fix your own errors.

Read full topic

item.title: Dot dot dot
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I started with writing my own java programs, then I moved on to rsps’s, if you can get to the point to where you can understand code by reading it, do what matzie said, and write commands, then read about switch statements, after you master those you can start writing things in the clickingbuttons, clicking items classes and others like those, after that, go into your server and read over skills, and see how they work, find out how everything pulls together, after that all you can do is practice with it, write your own java programs so you can understand it better, and work on your server at the same time.

Happy Coding!

Read full topic

item.title: Dot dot dot
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

philisophic.??? meaning?? >_>

i guess it would be a lot better knowledge to say i have been messing with computers since i was like… 7,8? i am pushing 20 now ~_~ java is still a past time but i have moved up in the world =3 going to college now and working on bachelors in computer science. will expand on that and currently only taking prereqs, but still =]

Read full topic

item.title: Dot dot dot
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

become one of us. be self taught, read tutorials, take a class(oracle offers online java coding classes, for a fee though of course, but then you can get certified to do it for a living as well,also depends on your age>.>), start with servers rather than clients.

i hate how people try to jump in with ones above 317 because they are much more difficult O_o
had they gotten into the 317’s when this first came around they wouldn’t have a problem =] was simple to learn, easy tuts to follow, and a lot to mess around with.

how i got started was messing around with rs. that moved in to a private server ( i made a lot of mistakes though and was full of errors constantly).
i basicly started looking around at things like commands and started inventing my own. i made a mod glow command by looking at gfx’s and how they work. understanding booleans(t/f) and how to make a command activate. good start to a first method to code =]

we all started somewhere. time to get your feet in the water, but don’t forget your floaties!

Read full topic
